titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to her Papers at the Indiana University Archives
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Malher

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-04 04:55:34 -0500.

did.abstract: Ellen Joan Norton (Houston) attended Indiana University from 1952 through 1955 and was a member of several student organizations. This collection contains two scrapbooks (1951-1955) and a small amount of loose photographs and ephemera that mainly document Norton's time at IU. The scrapbooks include photographs of dances and other social functions, news clippings, and academic awards received by Norton.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ellen Joan Norton (Houston), who was known as "Joan," was born in Indianapolis, Indiana on February 26, 1932. She attended Arsenal Technical School, where she graduated in 1950 as class secretary. After graduation, Joan briefly attended the University of Indianapolis before coming to Indiana University in 1952. She was a member of several student organizations while at IU, including Mortar Board, IU Student Foundation, and the YMCA Council. She was also involved in campus Greek life and eventually became the president of Zeta Tau Alpha. Her other memberships included the Alpha Lambda Delta national honorary society and Panhellenic Council. She was a regular honor student and became a Class Officer in her senior year.

After graduating from Indiana University with her B.S. in Business in 1955, Joan moved to Dallas, Texas, where she met her future husband, Dr. Neal Bryan Houston (1928-2009). The two married in late 1956. Houston began her career working for a department store as a purchaser for their candy department. Later on, she became a professional weaver.
Houston passed away in Nacogdoches, Texas, in 2014.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into one series with bound scrapbooks appearing first and loose material appearing at the end of the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two scrapbooks and a small amount of loose clippings, publications, photographs, and other memorabilia that document Joan Norton Houston's social and academic life at Indiana University. The scrapbooks that Houston created span 1951-1955 and contain photographs, newspaper clippings, correspondence, and memorabilia related to her participation in student organizations and attendance of dances and other social functions. The collection also contains some loose materials, including photographs from Houston's graduation from IU, her diploma, issues (1954-1955, 1959) of the Zeta Tau Alpha magazine Themis, a 1955 copy of the Indiana University Alumni Magazine, and a program for the fifth annual Little 500.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database

userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have not transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Joan Norton scrapbooks, Collection C690, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Donated to the University Archives by Joan Houston's friend Frances Lostracco, December 2014.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Note: This scrapbook chronicles Houston's early years at Indiana University. Arranged in chronological order, each page covers a specific topics or attended events. These include grade reports and certificates of achievement, programs for IU Theater productions, as well as other areas of campus life. Photographs and memorabilia from a variety of Indiana University dances such as the Dames Ball, Rose Ball, Military Ball, and Prom are also present. Also included are news clippings highlighting Houston's sorority Zeta Tau Alpha, as well as Indiana University and local events.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Note: A continuation in the chronology of Houston's time at Indiana University Bloomington, this scrapbook spans from 1953 to 1955. Like the previous book, this scrapbook includes correspondence, grade reports, and certificates of recognition, as well as programs and news clippings, which highlight a variety of experiences during Houston's time at IUB. Several pages highlight a trip by Houston to New York City. This includes Broadway playbills and memorabilia from places such as Radio City Music Hall and the Empire State Building, as well as a variety of photographs of the city and the Statue of Liberty. This scrapbook also covers Houston's attendance to the Zeta Tau Alpha National Convention in Miami.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Consists of articles pulled from the Indiana Daily Student, event programs from the Mortar Board, Zeta Tau Alpha events, the Alumnae-Senior Breakfast, Dames Ball, and Founders Day Exercises.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains Houston's diploma and the program for the 1955 Commencement

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of the Zeta Tau Alpha Creed and the 1954-1959 issues of the ZTA magazine Themis. Also included are a copy of the 1955 Indiana University Alumni Magazine and a program for the Fifth Annual Little 500.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of Houston both during and just after her time at IU
